title: BBQ Pulled Pork Sliders
description: Slow-braised, smoky pulled pork tossed in a tangy-sweet barbecue sauce and piled onto soft mini buns with crisp coleslaw for contrast. Uses a low-and-slow braise to break down the pork shoulder into tender shreds, finished with a caramelized pan sauce for extra depth.

ingredients.notes: leave some fat for flavor; trim excess
divided: some for braise, some for sauce/coleslaw
for braising liquid; chicken broth for savory depth

ingredients.display_name: slider buns (mini brioche or plain), about 8-12
ingredients.notes: use 2 buns per serving if desired

ingredients.display_name: prepared coleslaw (cabbage and carrot) or ingredients to make fresh
ingredients.notes: see notes for quick slaw: shredded cabbage, shredded carrot, mayo, vinegar, salt
or use yogurt for lighter slaw (changes allergen profile)

steps.text: Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C). Pat the pork shoulder dry and rub all over with kosher salt, black pepper, smoked paprika and brown sugar; let rest at room temperature while preparing other components.
Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven or oven-safe braising pot over medium-high heat. Sear the pork on all sides until deeply browned, about several minutes per side, then transfer pork to a plate.
Add quartered onion and smashed garlic to the pot and cook until softened and aromatic, deglazing the pan with a portion of the apple cider vinegar, scraping browned bits from the bottom.

Return the pork to the pot. Add apple juice or chicken broth and remaining apple cider vinegar, then bring liquid to a gentle simmer. Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid and transfer to the preheated oven.
Braise the pork low and slow in the oven until fork-tender and easily shreddable, about 3 to 3.5 hours, checking once midway to baste and ensure liquid remains at least 1/2 inch in the pan.

Remove the pot from the oven and transfer the pork to a cutting board. Reserve braising liquid and strain solids if desired. Using two forks or meat claws, shred the pork into bite-sized pieces, discarding excess fat and bone.

Make the barbecue sauce by combining ketchup, remaining apple cider vinegar, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce and mustard in a saucepan. Simmer briefly until slightly thickened, then taste and adjust seasoning.

Combine shredded pork with the prepared barbecue sauce in the pot and warm over medium-low heat, adding a few tablespoons of reserved braising liquid if needed to achieve a saucy but not watery consistency; simmer 6–8 minutes to marry flavors and caramelize edges slightly.

While pork finishes, prepare quick coleslaw: toss shredded cabbage and carrots with mayonnaise, a splash of apple cider vinegar, a pinch of salt and pepper. Chill or hold at cool room temperature until assembly.
Split slider buns and toast cut sides in a skillet with butter until golden and slightly crisp. Pile warm BBQ pulled pork onto each bun, top with coleslaw, close sliders and serve immediately.
